title: MOMENTUM Program Project
description: I am currently part of the MOMENTUM Program in a research project aimed to the understanding of genomic and epigenomic evolution of cancer in the response to epigenomic drugs.

title: The Genetic Background of Meniere's disease
description: I have worked on the analysis of genetic data from patients with Meniere's disease, and I have identified several genetic variants associated to the disease.

title: Tinnitus research European Consortium: from genetics to therapy
description: I have participated in the Tinnitus research European Consortium, a collaborative project aimed at the identification of genetic variants associated to tinnitus as well as new combination personalized therapies for patients.

title: Collaborations and internationalization
description: I have collaborated with several research groups in the development of new methods for the integration of omics data, including the identification of new biomarkers for rare disorders.

title: Teaching and dissemination
description: I have participated in several teaching and dissemination activities, including the organization of workshops and courses on bioinformatics and genetics.

title: Previous research projects
description: I have worked on a variety of genetic research projects in the past, including a omic integration data on inner ear disorders, a machine learning model for the prediction of biomarkers associated to rare disorders, and a statistical analysis of genetic data.
